A.translation[0].definitions[0].definiti: the first letter of the English alphabet
A.translation[0].definitions[1].definiti: the sixth note in the musical scale of C major or the musical key based on this note
A.translation[0].definitions[2].definiti: the highest mark that a student can get in an examination or for a piece of work
A.translation[0].definitions[2].example[: I got an A in French.
Julia got straight A’s (=all A’s) in high school.
A.translation[0].definitions[3].definiti: used to refer in a short way to one of two different things or people. You can call the second one B
A.translation[1].definitions[0].definiti: the written abbreviation of amp or  amps
A.translation[2].definitions[0].definiti: used to show that you are talking about someone or something that has not been mentioned before, or that your listener does not know about
A.translation[2].definitions[0].example[: There was a hole in the fence.
Suddenly they heard a loud bang.
A.translation[2].definitions[1].definiti: used to show that you are referring to a general type of person or thing and not a specific person or thing
A.translation[2].definitions[1].example[: I want to train to be an engineer.
A.translation[2].definitions[2].definiti: used before someone’s family name to show that they belong to that family
A.translation[2].definitions[2].example[: One of his daughters had married a Rothschild.
A.translation[2].definitions[3].example[: You’ll have to wait an hour or two.
A.translation[2].definitions[4].definiti: used in some phrases that say how much of something there is
A.translation[2].definitions[4].example[: There were a lot of people at the party.
A few weeks from now I’ll be in Venice.
You have caused a great deal of trouble.
A.translation[2].definitions[5].definiti: used to mean ‘each’ when stating prices, rates, or speeds
A.translation[2].definitions[5].example[: I get paid once a month.
A.translation[2].definitions[6].definiti: used before singular nouns to mean all things of a particular type
A.translation[2].definitions[6].example[: A square has four sides  (=all squares have four sides).
A child needs love and affection.
A.translation[2].definitions[7].definiti: used once before two nouns that are mentioned together very often
A.translation[2].definitions[7].example[: I’ll fetch you a cup and saucer.
Does everyone have a knife and fork?
A.translation[2].definitions[8].definiti: used before the -ing forms of verbs when they are used as nouns referring to an action, event, or sound
A.translation[2].definitions[8].example[: There was a beating of wings overhead.
Bernice became aware of a humming that seemed to come from all around her.
A.translation[2].definitions[9].definiti: used before nouns that are usually uncountable when other information about the quality, feeling etc is added by an adjective, phrase, or clause
A.translation[2].definitions[9].example[: Candidates must have a good knowledge of chemistry.
A.translation[2].definitions[10].definit: used before the name of a substance, food etc to refer to a particular type of it
A.translation[2].definitions[10].example: Use a good cheese to make the sauce.
plants that grow well in a moist soil
A.translation[2].definitions[11].definit: used before the name of a drink to refer to a cup or glass of that drink
A.translation[2].definitions[11].example: Can I get you a coffee?
Renwick went to the bar and ordered a beer.
A.translation[2].definitions[12].definit: used before the name of a famous artist to refer to a painting by that artist
A.translation[2].definitions[13].definit: used before a name to mean someone or something that has the same qualities as that person or thing
A.translation[2].definitions[13].example: She was hailed as a new Marilyn Monroe.
A.translation[2].definitions[14].definit: used before someone’s name when you do not know who they are
A.translation[2].definitions[14].example: There is a Mr Tom Wilkins on the phone.
A.translation[2].definitions[15].definit: used before the names of days, months, seasons, and events in the year to refer to a particular one
A.translation[2].definitions[15].example: We arrived in England on a cold wet Sunday in 1963.
I can’t remember a Christmas like it.
A.translation[2].note_box[0].heading: USAGE: A, an
A.translation[2].note_box[0].items[0].ex: Before a word beginning with a vowel sound, use an
A.translation[2].note_box[0].items[1].ex: Use an before an 'h' that is not pronounced
A.translation[2].note_box[0].items[2].ex: Use a before a 'u' that is pronounced like 'you'
A.translation[2].note_box[0].items[3].ex: Use an before an abbreviation that is pronounced with a vowel sound at the start
A.translation[3].definitions[0].definiti: in a particular condition or way
A.translation[3].definitions[1].definiti: in, to, at, or on something
A.translation[5].definitions[0].definiti: the highest mark that a student can get in a GCSE examination
